/home/hammer/slime/src/runtime/traceobj.h

00001 /* Matthew Hammer <hammer@tti-c.org> */
00002 
00003 /* Trace Objects -- Generalize both closures and heap-allocated blocks
00004    regarding support for recording, matching and reuse within the
00005    lookup tables of the trace.
00006    
00007    I use an explicit virtual-table approach to implement these in lieu
00008    of class support in C (recall that CIL doesn't currently support
00009    C++ programs).  For object-oriented people disgusted with my use of
00010    C, just think of traceobj_vtbl_t has specifying the signature of a
00011    class and traceobj_t as specifying the layout of the instances.
00012 */
00013 
00014 #ifndef __SLIME_TRACEOBJ_H__
00015 #define __SLIME_TRACEOBJ_H__
00016 
00017 typedef union  traceobj_owner_u traceobj_owner_t;
00018 typedef struct traceobj_s       traceobj_t;
00019 typedef struct traceobj_vtbl_s  traceobj_vtbl_t;
00020 
00021 /* Closures -- full definition in "closure.h" */
00022 typedef struct closure_s closure_t;
00023 
00024 /* Contexts -- full definition in "context.h" */
00025 typedef struct context_s context_t;
00026 
00027 #include <inttypes.h>
00028 #include "tracetbl.h"
00029 #include "timestamp.h"
00030 #include "hash.h"
00031 
00032 struct traceobj_vtbl_s {
00033   /* Pre-init stage: */
00034   const char*(*name) (traceobj_t* traceobj); /* A name for debugging */
00035   uintptr_t  (*size) (traceobj_t* traceobj); /* Total size in bytes */
00036   uintptr_t  (*sing) (traceobj_t* traceobj); /* Non-zero iff a singleton equiv-class */
00037   uintptr_t  (*buff) (traceobj_t* traceobj, unsigned char* buff); /* Fill buffer with bytes respecting equiv. */
00038   uintptr_t  (*hash) (traceobj_t* traceobj, uintptr_t hashin); /* Hash value, respecting equivalence */
00039   uintptr_t  (*eqiv) (traceobj_t* traceobj_1, traceobj_t* traceobj_2); /* Define equiv-class */
00040   timestamp_t* (*time) (traceobj_t* traceobj); /* Time in the timeline */
00041   
00042   /* Initialization. */
00043   void (*init) (traceobj_t* traceobj);
00044 
00045   /* Asymmetric way of combining equiv traceobjects.  The first is one
00046      requested by running code (but still uninitialized), and the
00047      second is from a reusable portion of the trace (and has thus been
00048      previously initialized). */
00049   void (*comb) (traceobj_t* traceobj_req, traceobj_t* traceobj_rsp);
00050 };
00051 
00052 
00053 /* The "immediate owner" (or just "owner" for short) of a live block
00054    is an executing/executed closure.  The immediate owner of a dead
00055    block is a reuse context.
00056 
00057    Side Note: The immediate owner of an executed closure (live in the
00058    timeline) is still a strange notion and we currently don't support
00059    it.  If that closure is never mentioned explicitly in the surface
00060    code (e.g., never bound to a name) we can safely treat it as if the
00061    timeline is the closure's owner.  On the other hand, if we allow
00062    first-class closures then we'll have to worry about having both an
00063    owner and a context (which won't ordinary be the same thing unless
00064    the closure is dead).
00065 */
00066 union traceobj_owner_u {
00067   context_t* context; /* use if dead block or live-exec closure, mask low bits */
00068   closure_t* closure; /* use if live block or live-susp closure, mask low bits */
00069   uintptr_t flags;
00070   /*
00071     Flags:
00072     bit 0: isalive= 1 (treat next/prev as also alive) or 0 (treat next/prev as also dead)
00073     bit 1: isowner= 1 (next/prev are "children") or 0 (next/prev are "siblings")
00074 
00075     Define: CONTEXT(traceobj) =
00076       if not isalive then context
00077       else if isowner then context
00078       else closure->context
00079 
00080     Define: OWNER(traceobj) =
00081       if not isalive then NULL
00082       else if isowner then NULL
00083       else closure
00084 
00085     Define: TIME(traceobj) =
00086       let owner = OWNER(traceobj) in
00087       if owner then owner->begtime
00088       else End-of-Timeline    
00089   */
00090 };
00091 
00092 struct traceobj_s {
00093   traceobj_vtbl_t* vtbl;
00094   traceobj_owner_t owner;
00095   traceobj_t* next;
00096   traceobj_t* prev;
00097   void* body[0];
00098 };
00099 
00100 /* Always returns 0 */
00101 uintptr_t traceobj_sing_false(traceobj_t* traceobj); 
00102 
00103 /* Always returns non-zero */
00104 uintptr_t traceobj_sing_true(traceobj_t* traceobj); 
00105 
00106 /* Instantiate a traceobj given its vtbl. -- TODO: in the future this
00107    should also take a size parameter since the size op in the vtbl
00108    requires an instance to run. */
00109 traceobj_t* traceobj_inst(const traceobj_vtbl_t* vtbl); 
00110 
00111 /* Non-zero iff live */
00112 uintptr_t   traceobj_isalive(traceobj_t* traceobj); 
00113 
00114 /* Non-zero iff is an owner */
00115 uintptr_t   traceobj_isowner(traceobj_t* traceobj); 
00116 
00117 /* Get context of traceobj -- result shouldn't be NULL. */
00118 context_t* traceobj_context(traceobj_t* traceobj); 
00119 
00120 /* Get owning closure of traceobj -- result may be NULL. */
00121 closure_t* traceobj_closure(traceobj_t* traceobj); 
00122 
00123 /* Set the given traceobj as live -- updates context as current
00124    context, sets isowner flag to true. */
00125 void traceobj_make_owner(traceobj_t* traceobj);
00126 
00127 /* Set the given traceobj as live -- updates owner as current closure,
00128    sets isowner flag to false. */
00129 void traceobj_make_ownees(traceobj_t* traceobj);
00130 
00131 /* Clears the islive flag -- changes the owner to the context of the
00132    former owner. */
00133 void traceobj_kill_ownee(traceobj_t* traceobj);
00134 
00135 
00136 /* Insert the first traceobj sequence after the second.  Both are
00137    assumed to start as loops.  The flag arguments control the SEQCONT
00138    bits of the links that are created between the joined
00139    sequences. The flag [flag_A_B] toggles the flag on
00140    [last(traceobjs_A)->next] and the flag [flag_B_A] toggles the flag
00141    on [last(traceobjs_B)->next]. */
00142 void traceobj_link(traceobj_t* traceobjs_A,   
00143                    traceobj_t* traceobjs_B,
00144                    uintptr_t flag_A_B,
00145                    uintptr_t flag_B_A);
00146 
00147 /* Remove the sequence of traceobjs given the first one (may be a
00148    singleton sequence).  Returns the first traceobj after the removed
00149    sequence, if any.  If the unlinked sequence is the only sequence,
00150    it returns NULL. */
00151 traceobj_t* traceobj_unlink(traceobj_t* traceobjs);
00152 
00153  /* Free traceobj (reclaim to freeset) -- it should be freed only when
00154     it is certain to be dead (e.g., at the end of a change
00155     propagation). */
00156 void traceobj_free(traceobj_t* traceobj);
00157 
00158 #endif
